byline.original: By DAVID McNICOLL Sidney Daily Telegraph Correspondent

docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO, June 12-- Although the economic and social council of the new world organization will have power to call international conferences, it was learned today that the United States and British Governments do not favor waiting for...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, June 12-- Although the economic and social council of the new world organization will have power to call international conferences, it was learned today that the United States and British Governments do not favor waiting for ratification of the new world charter before calling an international economic conference.
docs.abstract: US and GB favor internatl econ conf even before world charter is ratified; council powers noted

byline.original: By RUSSELL PORTER Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 13--The movement of 4,453,061 American troops to Europe to fight the Axis was accomplished with the "comparatively small" loss of lives of 3,604 soldiers through the sinking and damaging of forty-one troop ships, the War Department...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 13--The movement of 4,453,061 American troops to Europe to fight the Axis was accomplished with the "comparatively small" loss of lives of 3,604 soldiers through the sinking and damaging of forty-one troop ships, the War Department said tonight.

headline.main: 3,604 Troops Were Lost on Ships Taking 4,453,061 Men to Europe; War Department Says This Was Toll on 41 Ships Sunk or Damaged in West--Record Far Better Than in '17, '18 Comparison With Last War List of Ships Involved
